titleStmt.title: Letter from Richard Duggin to John G. Neihardt, February 8, 1973
titleStmt.author: Duggin, Richard

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Letter from Richard Duggin to John G. Neihardt, February 8, 1973

msIdentifier.repository: John G. Neihardt Center Research Library, Aly Collection

div1.fw: THE UNIVERSITY OF NEBRASKA AT OMAHA ans. 2-16-15 30 UNIVERSITY OF NEBRASKA AT OMAHA P.O. Box 688 Omaha, Nebraska 68101 Telephone 402/553-4700 University of Omaha 1908-31 Municipal University of Omaha 1931-68 College of Arts Sciences Department of English UNO-Community Writer's Workshop
div1.p: The University of Nebraska at Omaha has recently created a School of Fine Arts, approved by the Board of Regents this semester. Included in the new School are the Divisions of Art, Music, Dramatic Arts, Dance, The Fine Arts Press, and The Program in Writing, UNO-Community Writer's Workshop.

To help celebrate the creation of this new union of the arts, the Divisions of the School are inviting guest artists in their respective disciplines to visit the campus. We in the Writer's Workshop felt there could be no better way to contribute to that celebration than by inviting Nebraska's most distinguished poet.

It is for this reason that I write to ask if it will be possible for you to make an appearance at UNO this spring--perhaps in April or in the first part of May--to do evening of poetry readings from your work. The format for the program will, of course, be entirely of your own choosing.
We look forward to hearing from you with the hope that we may begin making plans for your participation.

closer.signed: Richard Duggin Richard Duggin, Director The Program in Writing UNO-Community Writer's Workshop
closer.note: THE UNIVERSITY OF NEBRASKA-LINCOLN THE UNIVERSITY OF NEBRASKA AT OMAHA THE UNIVERSITY OF NEBRASKA MEDICAL CENTER
